Hero.textLeft:
Do you want to change
the industry?

PageName.body: The foundation of the project lies in the team and in the people who believe in the academy. We share a common mission and work hard to open up new opportunities for future cadets.

Project.title: About the project
body: Academie One is Kazakhstan's first career-oriented programming academy, where we teach and learn differently. We solve the problem of a shortage of IT specialists on the market, while opening up access to a new educational learning environment for those who are looking for new ways to develop.

Modern teaching methods are based on peer-to-peer interaction. This means that everyone is a teacher and a student, and there will be no teachers or grades. There will be many lines of code and fellow students checking you out and discussing projects with you.
If you are looking for a way to learn to program and find yourself in the IT market, the academy will be useful for you to get yourself and your skills up to speed.

Brand.body: Discover, Unite, and Advance talent for global impact.

BrandManifesto.title: Manifesto
body: We believe that a whole new era awaits, one characterized by equal opportunities for people looking for self-fulfillment because the most valuable resource in the world is people with knowledge.
Talent is what drives our society to change. The belief that we can change the future inspires us to change. Talent, when inspired, can change the future. After all, change is constant progress.
We aspire to connect local talent to the world. Let's build a digital community that can solve problems and influence change.

items.title: Integrity
items.body: Everything we do, we do in good faith and with honesty

items.title: Inspired
items.body: We do what we love and we do it for a greater idea.

items.title: Creative
items.body: We are creative to make new things and improve existing ones.

items.title: Together
items.body: We do it in cooperation. We are creating a new future opportunity. Each person's contribution is important to the common cause.

items.title: Discovery
items.body: We support the freedom of each person to pursue knowledge and discover new talents.

items.title: Culture
items.body: We create a supportive culture for growth, where everyone can reach their potential.

items.name: Yerdos Mendybayev
items.title: Founder of the Academie
items.bio: the majority shareholder and historical leader of the Iliad Group. Self-taught entrepreneur, he has been working in the telematics, Internet and telecommunications industry since the end of the 1980s.
body: The challenges faced by the country are known and well-documented by analysts and media throughout the world. With all-time same story again and again – oil & gas, mining, agriculture, logistics. What is missing though, is a contrarian perspective, which, while recognizing the challenges and risks, also gives a voice to the compelling reasons to consider other sectors of Kazakhstan economy as an investment destination.

With oil prices taking a deep dive and COVID-19 pandemia, Kazakh economy is struggling with no clear perspectives. Though, each crisis opens up opportunities, and the latter is the reason to consider investment opportunity into human talent advancement.

Companies in post-pandemic world will accelerate digitization, while finding the right human talent will represent greater challenge. By 2025, the number of new technology-oriented jobs available in global digital ecosystem is estimated at 149 million, according to a Microsoft study.

We have launched Academie One to discover and advance human talent from Central Asia for the global world. More than 2000 cadets will be integrated at our educational platform supported by Nicolas Sadirac's 01 Edu System.
We believe new generation of developers will benefit from an unprecedented global opportunities 21st century has to offer.

items.title: Conditions of Use
items.body: In keeping with Law 34/2002, of June 11, Information Society Services and Electronic Commerce (LSSI-CE), ACADEMIE ONE LLC informs the user that they are the owner of the website WWW.ACADEMIE.ONE. In keeping with what is established in Article 10 of the cited Law, ACADEMIE ONE LLC informs users of the following:

items.title: Users and responsibility regime
items.body: By browsing, accessing and using ACADEMIE ONE LLC’s website, constitutes the person as a user. As a result of browsing ACADEMIE ONE LLC’s website, the said user accepts all the conditions of use established herein, notwithstanding the application of the corresponding obligatory regulations applicable in each case.

PageName.body: To apply, we only ask that you are open-minded, motivated and ready to commit to our 4-year educational and work program program and you must be at least 18.

items.question: What is 01 Edu System?
items.answer: Platform 01 Edu System is the new generation of educational solutions developed by the team of Nicolas Sadirak. Its purpose is to fill the shortage of creative programmers around the world. Technological solutions like these have already proven their worth at Ecole 42, Epitech, and web@cademie.

items.question: Why are there no teachers?
items.answer: Academie One is an education based on peer-to-peer learning, in which students learn and discover by themselves and with peers. There is, however, a pedagogical team that makes sure the learning environment works and that students are progressing.

items.question: What does 'peer-to-peer learning' mean?
items.answer: Peer-to-peer learning is an education model where students learn from each other instead of learning from an appointed teacher. It emphasizes critical thinking, teamwork, and communication. Students also evaluate each other and learn from explaining to peers.

items.question: Is it possible to study at the academy without knowing English?
items.answer: It is possible, but we highly recommend to learn English along the way.

items.question: What are the requirements to apply?
items.answer: What matters most to us is your motivation and commitment to the two-year program. We do not look at your prior experience, education, or degree, as all applicants start from the same starting point in the training system. However, we ask that applicants be at least 18 years old and no more than 42 years old by the time the Piscine selection begins.

items.question: Do I have to know the basics of coding before I apply?
items.answer: No programming knowledge is required. The pool starts with the most basic things in computer science.

items.question: How many places are available each year?
items.answer: It is planned to recruit 200 candidates for each piscine. After passing the piscine, the system determines the threshold passing score. Next, candidates are determined who have passed this threshold score.

items.question: Do I need to be good at math?
items.answer: The programming is not about math, programming is art. You have to be creative.

items.question: Why is the 4-week intensive training called Piscine?
items.answer: The word “Piscine” is the French word for “swimming pool”, meaning that everyone dives into the deep end of coding and learns how to swim together. This is a four-week trial period. This period will be very stressful and will require commitment. During Piscine, you will discover the basics of programming from scratch.

items.question: What happens if I fail the Piscine? Can I try again?
items.answer: Unfortunately, after a fail in the pool, you will not be able to go through it again. These conditions allow students to take the pool seriously. Don't worry if you don't get through, there are different ways to learn to program and we encourage you to try other styles as well.

items.question: What if I want to quit the Piscine in the middle?
items.answer: That is okay! Applicants are free to leave the admissions process at any point. You can just walk out, with no strings attached.

items.question: What does the curriculum include?
items.answer: The first step in learning is to learn the Go programming language and fundamental programming concepts. As you progress through the pool, you will have access to many areas of computer science with deeper branches: object-oriented programming, mobile programming, functional programming, web security, reverse engineering, malicious code, kernel programming, network programming, artificial intelligence, 3D programming and many other areas of programming and IT.

items.question: How long does it take to complete the program?
items.answer: We strongly believe that every student is unique and should be able to learn at their own pace. The course of study takes on average 2 years of full-time employment. But the course may take over 2 years or less. It depends on your pace of learning. But this is not a race. It is about learning, not winning.

items.question: How's the curriculum is gamified?
items.answer: You progress through the curriculum by completing projects and earning points. With these points, you level up and unlock more projects and specializations. You can also learn various skills, complete quests, and achievements.

items.question: What kind of jobs will I be able to apply for?
items.answer: Completing the course gives you access to a multitude of positions and jobs in the digital world. Upon completion of the training, we will invite you to work and create pleasant working conditions. This will mean that you will gain invaluable hands-on experience working on real projects.

items.question: Can I come back to school even after graduation?
items.answer: Graduates can return to continue their studies at any time when they want to master new technologies and gain new knowledge. We would like to see alumni remain part of the community.

items.question: What's the language used in the school?
items.answer: All of the academy's content and projects will be available only in English. It is an important language to develop if you want to thrive in the digital world. We want our students to think globally.

items.question: Is it possible to study remotely?
items.answer: You can work on your projects remotely from your computer, as well as meet and discuss your projects with other students, but you will not have access to the academy's servers.

items.question: Can I study part-time?
items.answer: It is possible but very difficult. To be successful in your studies, you will have to spend most of your time in the education cluster. We recommend studying 40 hours a week.

items.question: Can I stop my studies halfway?
items.answer: We strongly recommend that you do not stop studying, at least for the duration of basic training. But if necessary, you can pause your studies or rest for a couple of weeks.

PageName.body: We believe in high-quality IT education for those who want to take on challenges, regardless of their background. Thus, helping talents to unleash their full creativity.

Methodology.body: Collaboration is the foundation of peer learning. Students complete their projects in teams to maximize their creativity and stimulates curiosity.

items.title: Peer Learning
items.body: The Peer-to-Peer methodology teaches cadets to work as a team: share information, ideas, and experiences. Be a student and a teacher simultaneously.

items.title: Learning by doing
items.body: Students do not talk in their professors' memorized words; instead, they explore the problem and defend their solutions.

items.title: Flexible schedule
items.body: The Education cluster will be open seven days a week, 24 hours a day, so you are free to set your schedule. Cadets usually spend an average of 40 hours per week.

items.title: Tuition Free
items.body: World class IT education with a 100% scholarship.

items.title: Job Guaranteed
items.body: Build your experience and expand your portfolio with international projects with a competitive salary.

items.title: Silicon Valley Lifestyle
items.body: iMacs, Macbooks + Community library, gym and many more in a 24/7 open space.

Edu.h2Title: 01 Edu System by world renown Nicolas Sadirac
Edu.body: 01 Edu System is a collaborative education platform to open and run revolutionary coding schools. Its founder Nicolas Sadirac has rigorously designed the curriculum for 20 years to prepare world-class software engineers.

Campus.body: iMacs, library, gym, cafeteria, gaming area with chess, tennis and PS4, and meditation areas available 24/7 on the palms of your hands on the Academie One campus located in the historical refurbished tea packing factory...

Cluster.title: Education Cluster
Cluster.body: An educational campus is an open and immersive space designed for a complete and comfortable immersion in the learning process. It is a creative and safe space, equipped with cutting edge technologies that foster collaboration, communication and teamwork. The total area of the academy is 4042 sq. m

Almaty.body: Surrounded by beautiful mountain ranges, it is home to many technology companies and large enterprises. It is ideal for studying and living with excellent infrastructure, stunning views, and warm culture.

PageName.body: Our learning approach involves no teachers, no semesters and no boredom — the program bases on peer learning, individual growth, and lots of practice. By the way, job guaranteed

Piscine.title: 1. Pisciner
Piscine.body: The Piscine is the final step to join the academy. You have a will discover the methodology, its unique learning method, and what programming is. It's a chance to know each other better.

items.title: New experience
items.body: Many students consider Piscine to be one of the highlights of their student life. Everyone around you shares a similar vision and passion for learning.

items.title: Growth mindset
items.body: There will be a lot of trial and error to help you better understand the problem. You work by yourself and in groups, ask your peers for help, and help your peers complete projects.

Cadet.body: The curriculum offers over 100 projects that are consistently updated to reflect the latest industry standards. With ten different learning areas to choose from, students will move through two learning stages at the Academie: fundamentals and specialization.

Portfolio.body: Each project you finish in the curriculum goes to your portfolio, which will project your unique skillset.

Career.body: Once you graduate, Academie One guarantees employment to help you kick-start your career with international projects.

Contract.body: When you sign a contract, you get guaranteed employment and free training. In general, the skills development program lasts four years. The first two years you learn programming skills, and the last two years you build up your portfolio with work projects. The contract provides both parties with a guarantee of future cooperation.

Offer.body: We provide guaranteed employment. This experience can help you in your future employment with other IT companies. The job offer includes such things as a market salary, a comfortable workspace, interesting international projects, lifetime access to Academie One, a social package, and a community of like-minded people and etc.

Alumni.body: Once you finish the program, you have lifetime access to the 01 Edu System platform. You will always stay at a bleeding-edge as Academie One alumni.

items.title: Fundamentals
items.body: The projects you work on will introduce you to the core principles of Computer Science. Rather than a series of languages and specific technologies, we will teach you how to learn effectively. With that knowledge, every new fancy technology will be easy to grasp. We call it skills for a lifetime.

items.title: Specialization
items.body: Once you become more familiar with the basics, you will work on more complex projects in larger teams. It is the perfect time to choose which field you want to specialize in.

Ability.title: Skills of the program
Ability.title2: That employers are looking for in digital world
Ability.body: The program generates a great diversity of co-creative digital talents highly valuable and sought-after to drive innovation and development, in all fields of digital transformation and technology.

PageName.body: Before you can take off with coding at Academie One, you need to take some small steps. Buckle up and let's get started!

items.title: 1. Registration & Interview
items.body: Create an account on the 01 Edu platform and complete two online games. First game takes around 5 minutes to complete. Second is a longer and usually takes 1 hour. `. No coding is required. If you pass the game, you will receive a link for the introduction meeting with Team One.

items.title: 2. Piscine
items.body: Successful candidates who pass the online test will be invited to take the four-week Piscine at Academie One campus. It is the final part of our admission process that introduces you to our educational model.

items.title: 3. Review
items.body: If you are selected for the Cadet program, you will have a month to try the program and decide whether you fit in the academy environment. Enjoy the program? Let's evaluate your offer with us.

ImportantDates.title: Important Dates
body: more dates for Piscines to be announced

PageName.body: For general inquiries, please contact us at contact@academie.one
We have prepared a media kit to use our logo and branding elements. We hope you find the materials you need to create your content.

items.title: Media Kit
items.body: Our current brand assets, including the logo, images, and additional materials.

items.title: Brandbook
items.body: The main assistant who will advise on how to properly use the logo and colors.

inquire.body: For press inquiries, contact us at press@academie.one
